message.requestAccepted: It might take some time for your request to be processed in the background. You can leave this page.

directory.description: Configure synchronization and onboarding settings for your connected company directories. You can also add connections to Microsoft Azure Active Directory here. To add connections to an on-premises Microsoft Active Directory or LDAP directory, you must install an on-premises instance of the BlackBerry Connectivity Node and add the connections in the Connectivity Node settings.

page.title: General Information
page.description: Create a Microsoft Azure Directory connection using your credentials.

generate.title: Install a BlackBerry Connectivity Node
generate.bcnStep1Title: Step 1: Download and install the BlackBerry Connectivity Node
generate.bcnStep2Title: Step 2: Generate and download activation file
generate.bcnStep2Description: Generate the activation credentials to enable communication between the BlackBerry Connectivity Node and BlackBerry UES. Activation credentials can only be used once and are valid for 60 minutes after creation.
generate.bcnStep3Title: Step 3: Install and configure BlackBerry Connectivity Node
generate.bcnStep3Description: Run the BlackBerry UES setup application with the BlackBerry Connectivity Node option. After the installation process completes, open and configure the BlackBerry Connectivity Node.

table.removePopperText: Do you want to delete the {{serverName}} server?
table.description: Add and manage on-premises instances of the BlackBerry Connectivity Node. You must install a BlackBerry Connectivity Node to add connections to an on-premises Microsoft Active Directory or LDAP directory. After you add connections to an on-premises directory, configure synchronization and onboarding settings for the directory in the Directory Connection settings.

delete.title: Confirm delete.
delete.description: This action will delete this BlackBerry Connectivity Node.

settings.title: Connectivity Node logging
settings.bcnLoggingDescription: Specify the logging level, Syslog information, and local file information for BlackBerry Connectivity Node events.

validation.outOfRange: The value must be between {{min}} and {{max}}.

helperText.host: Specify the URL for the SysLog server.
helperText.port: Specify the port for the SysLog server.
helperText.maximumLogFileSize: Specify, in MB, the maximum log file size.
helperText.maximumServerLogFileAge: Specify, in days, the maximum server log file age.
